page.title: 01Farmland East of Irvine
page.content: The area conprises unbroken farmland lying equidistant between the large manufacturing towns of Kilmarnock & & Irvine. It is sparsely populated, consisting mainly of large dairy farms. In the SE and SW corners, it includes parts of the industrial villages of springside and Knockentiber, testimony to the extensive coal mining industry which is now defunct and whose workings are mostly returned to farm use it is served by a network of narrow minor roads which bear little traffic. A disused railway diagonally bisects the area and is converted to a walkway for leisure use. The hamlet of Cunninghamhead comprises farms, industrial buildings and a recent housing development; however, the major sources of employment lie in agriculture or outside the area in
